meanings.definition: To mark or highlight with red ink
meanings.sent1: I will rubricate the important points in my notes with a red pen.
meanings.sent2: She likes to rubricate headings in her notebook to make them stand out.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to rubricate the key terms in their essays for emphasis.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to rubricate the canvas with passion and precision.
meanings.sent5: The sunset seemed to rubricate the sky with vibrant hues of red and orange.

meanings.definition: To add decorative elements to a manuscript
meanings.sent1: The scribe would rubricate the borders of the manuscript with intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: In medieval times, monks would rubricate manuscripts with elaborate illustrations.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to rubricate their storybook with glitter and stickers.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to rubricate the pages of the book, bringing them to life.
meanings.sent5: The artist would rubricate the margins of the manuscript with delicate patterns.

meanings.definition: To provide instructions or guidelines for a task
meanings.sent1: The manual will rubricate the steps needed to assemble the furniture.
meanings.sent2: It is important to rubricate the recipe with clear directions for best results.
meanings.sent3: The coach decided to rubricate the game plan to ensure everyone understood their roles.
meanings.sent4: Her gestures seemed to rubricate the dance moves, making them easier to follow.
meanings.sent5: The map was rubricated with detailed landmarks to guide travelers on their journey.
